subject: Real Estate
title: The Condominium Concept
description: Learn The Condominium Concept in one minute.

hook.text: For most of history, you either owned a whole building or rented. There was no middle ground.

buildup.text: In 1961, the U.S. passed the first condo law, letting people own individual apartment units.

discovery.text: Buyers got a deed for their unit plus a share of common areas like hallways and pools.

twist.text: Condo associations gained enormous power â€” they could fine you, restrict pets, even pick your paint color.

climax.text: Condos made urban ownership accessible but created a new layer of private governance.

punchline.text: You own the walls but share the rules.

quiz.question: What did condominium law allow people to own?
options: Only the land beneath a building
